intro: Octomeria paulensis, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to purple flowers. Its fruit is a yellow, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Octomeria paulensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
